details.title: Activity Planning for the Space Station
details.abstract: This paper presents an overview of the identification and selection process of experiments and payloads for manned space flight missions, emphasizing the scope and magnitude of the problem of doing activity planning and the need for a methodology to assure timely flight and appropriate spacecraft design. Conclusions and results derived from the past several years are presented together with an analysis of the current procedure for defining activity for the space station.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
